jopt.csp.spi.arcalgorithm.constraint.num.global
Class GlobalCardinalityConstraint

java.lang.Object
  jopt.csp.spi.arcalgorithm.variable.VariableChangeBase
      jopt.csp.spi.arcalgorithm.constraint.AbstractConstraint
          jopt.csp.spi.arcalgorithm.constraint.num.global.GlobalCardinalityConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
jopt.csp.variable.CspConstraint, GraphConstraint, NumConstants, PostableConstraint, VariableChangeSource
public class GlobalCardinalityConstraint
extends AbstractConstraint

A global constraint that enforces a minimum and maximum cardinality of certain values among a set of sources.

Constructor Detail

GlobalCardinalityConstraint

public GlobalCardinalityConstraint(NumExpr[] sources,
                                   java.lang.Number[] vals,
                                   int[] lb,
                                   int[] ub)
This will construct a global cardinality constraint among the source expressions, binding the number of times each val from vals shows up to be between a lower bound lb and upper bound ub

Parameters:
sources - - A list of num expressions of which we are concerned with how many values it contains among them
vals - - a list of values for which we are concerned how often they appear among the
lb - - the minimum number of times the parallel value from vals shows up among sources
ub - - the maximum number of times the parallel value from vals shows up among sources

GlobalCardinalityConstraint

public GlobalCardinalityConstraint(GenericNumExpr source,
                                   java.lang.Number[] vals,
                                   int[] lb,
                                   int[] ub)
This will construct a global cardinality constraint among the source expressions, binding the number of times each val from vals shows up to be between a lower bound lb and upper bound ub Notice we remember that this is derived from a generic source, but we treat it as a normal gcc. The only time that the genericness affects performance is that we want to retain the ability to generate a gcc based on only a portion of values.

Parameters:
source - A generic num expression of which we are concerned with how many of each value it contains among them
vals - a list of values for which we are concerned how often they appear among the
lb - the minimum number of times the parallel value from vals shows up among sources
ub - the maximum number of times the parallel value from vals shows up among sources

isViolated

public boolean isViolated(boolean allViolated)
Description copied from class: AbstractConstraint
Returns true if constraint cannot be satisfied. If all violated is true, this method returns true only when all conditions are violated. If all violated is false, this method returns true when any condition is violated. The presence of multiple conditions is an issue when generic vars/exprs are involved.

Overrides:
isViolated in class AbstractConstraint
Parameters:
allViolated - Determines the criteria for violation
